message.201: The request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.
message.202: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.
message.203: The returned meta information in the entity-header is not the definitive set as available from the origin server, but is gathered from a local or a third-party copy.
message.204: The server has fulfilled the request but does not need to return new information.
message.205: The server has fulfilled the request and the client should reset the document view which caused the request to be sent to allow the user to initiate another input action.
message.206: The server has fulfilled the partial GET request for the resource.

message.300: The requested resource corresponds to ambiguous or multiple choices.
message.301: The requested resource has been assigned a new permanent Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) and any future references to the resource should use one of the returned URIs.
message.302: The requested resource resides temporarily under a different Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
message.303: The response to the request can be found under a different Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) and should be retrieved using a GET method on that resource.
message.304: The client requested a resource that has not been modified.
message.305: The requested resource must be accessed through the proxy given by the Location field.
message.306: Used in a previous version of the HTTP specification but is no longer used and the code is reserved.
message.307: The requested resource resides temporarily under a different Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

message.400: The request could not be understood by the server due to invalid syntax.
message.401: The requested resource requires user authentication.
message.402: Not implemented. Reserved for future use.
message.403: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.
message.404: The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI (Uniform Resource Identifier).
message.405: The method in the Request-Line is not allowed for the resource identified by the Request-URI.
message.406: The response from the request has content characteristics that are not acceptable to the accept headers sent by the client.
message.407: The client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.
message.408: The client did not produce a request within server timeout limit.
message.409: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource. The user should resolve the conflict and resubmit the request.
message.410: The requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known.
message.411: The server refuses to accept the request without a defined Content-Length.
message.412: The precondition given in one or more of the request-header fields evaluated False when tested on the server.
message.413: The server is refusing to process a request because the request entity is larger than the server is willing or able to process.
message.414: The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
message.415: The server is refusing to service the request because the entity of the request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
message.416: A request included a Range request-header field, and none of the range-specifier values in this field overlap the current extent of the selected resource, and the request did not include an If-Range request-header field.
message.417: The expectation given in an Expect request-header field could not be met by this server, or, if the server is a proxy, the server has unambiguous evidence that the request could not be met by the next-hop server.

message.500: The server does not support, or refuses to support, the HTTP protocol version that was used in the request message.
message.501: The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, did not receive a time out while waiting for a response from the upstream server specified by the URI (e.g. HTTP, FTP, LDAP) or some other auxiliary server (e.g. DNS) it needed to access in attempting to complete the request.
message.502: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.
message.503: The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from the upstream server it accessed in attempting to fulfill the request.
message.504: The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.
message.505: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.
